description: large dish with sloping sides; white ground glaze; decorated in brown, blue, and black; center: shield with two red (gules) lions gambs, crossed in saltire, a chess rook above [in chief], arms of the Morelli; sides decorated with scrolling gridwork of blue stems with blue and brown flowers and blue leaf clusters; underside decorated with blue and brown scrolling vines and leaves
markings: on bottom: five stickers and sticker fragments, including two Christie\'s stickers
text: Spanish ceramic production was the most sophisticated in Europe in the 15th century. This lusterware dish was produced by Islamic potters in Manises, Valencia--an important center of production for the luxury wares. It was commissioned by the distinguished Morelli family of Florence and exported to Renaissance Italy,  The Morelli arms appear at the center of the dish, surrounded by a fusion of Islamic and Gothic decorative motifs rendered in glazes of shimmering copper and cobalt blue.
title: Dish
